options.text: a sporophyte which is of longer duration.
a dominant phase of sporophyte which is parasitic
a dominant phase of gametophyte which produces spores.
a small sporophyte phase which is generally parasitic on the gametophyte.

solution.text:
In Bryophytes, sporophyte is never independent but is parasitic over gametophytic plant either partially for water and mineral supply or wholly for organic food.
The sporophyte is not free-living but attached to the photosynthetic gametophyte and derives nourishment from it. Some cells of the sporophyte undergo reduction division (meiosis) to produce haploid spores. These spores germinate to produce gametophyte.
A dominant, independent, photosynthetic, thalloid or erect phase is represented by a haploid gametophyte and it alternates with the shortlived multicelluler sporophyte totally or partially dependent on the gametophyte for its anchorage and nutrition. All bryophytes represent this pattern.
